page.title: 07LOCAL EMPLOYMENT
page.content: There is very little unemployment in the area as the people who live inthe villages tend to do so because of the surroundings rather than the employment it offers. Most people go to work in the nearby towns, but those who remain in the villages work mainly in the service industries such as building or as electricians and run their businesses from home. There is also a leather worker, a trailer maker and repairer. In Oakhill the local builder still remains the local undertaker. One or two new, small industries are starting up such as a cement stone manufacturer, furniture maker and antique pine renovator. All these only supply one or two jobs and young people expect to travel away to find work, unlike the old days when the brewery alone supplied a 100 jobs.
